intro: Aglitheis tricoccum, commonly known as the Appalachian trillium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its three large, waxy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces a single, upright stem that bears a single, showy white or pinkish flower with six petals. Its fruit is a three-lobed capsule that releases small, dark seeds. The plant thrives in moist, shaded forest floors and plays an important role in its ecosystem.
